🎯 Key Takeaways for quick navigation:  00:00 📝 Scientific notation is a way to represent very large or small numbers easily. 01:00 🧮 To convert from scientific to decimal notation, adjust the decimal based on the exponent. 02:33 🚀 Positive exponent makes the number very large; move the decimal to the right. 04:33 📉 Negative exponent makes the number very small; move the decimal to the left. 07:42 🔄 To convert from decimal to scientific notation, adjust the decimal and exponent accordingly. 20:15 ✖️ When multiplying in scientific notation, multiply the numbers and add the exponents. 24:23 ➗ When dividing in scientific notation, divide the numbers and subtract the exponents. 26:35 🤔 Quick mental trick: associate powers of ten with values (e.g., 10^3 is 1000, 10^6 is a million). 26:50 🧮 When dividing numbers in scientific notation, subtract the exponents and perform the division. 27:32 📊 To divide 36 times 10^7 by 4 times 10^4, subtract the exponents: 7 - 4 = 3, resulting in 9 times 10^3. 28:19 🧠 Negative exponents in division lead to positive exponents in the result. Example: 96 times 10^(-5) divided by 6 times 10^2 becomes 1.6 times 10^(-6). 29:34 🔄 When subtracting numbers in scientific notation with like terms, simply subtract the coefficients. 30:47 🔄 When adding numbers with different exponents, convert one to match the other before performing addition. 31:48 📐 Converting smaller exponents to larger ones for addition makes calculations easier. 34:02 🧾 When subtracting in scientific notation, focus on the number with the smaller exponent and convert it to match the larger one before subtraction. 36:11 🔄 Calculating square roots in scientific notation involves separating into two parts and applying the root to each part. 38:43 🔄 Square root of numbers in scientific notation requires converting the coefficient to a perfect square. 40:45 📈 When squaring numbers in scientific notation, square the coefficient and double the exponent. Example: 4 times 10^(-3) squared becomes 1.6 times 10^(-5). 41:41 🔄 When raising a number in scientific notation to a power, multiply the exponent by the power. Example: 5 times 10^4 raised to the third power becomes 5 times 10^12.  Made with HARPA AI

800 * 10E-9 = 0.000008 (5 zeros) => that's E-9 => is 9-1 = 8, 8 - (length of value x, if 10 = length is 2, if 100 length= 3 etc..), so length of 800 =3, now 8-3= 5 (zeros)
